intro: Allosorus skinneri, commonly known as the Skinner's allosorus, is a rare and unique member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that resemble those of other umbelliferous plants. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in an umbel, typical of its family. It is native to specific regions in South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
